result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Jolson Dees was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with 13CF256.  Eligible for Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years.

superMiscConds.notes: $518 costs--DOC collect.  If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

January 8, 2016--Sentencing Hearing (full transcript filed in 13CF256)

Defendant Charles Jolson Dees in court in custody with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders 4 years WSP, 2 years extended supervision, concurrent with 13CF256; 224 days sentence credit; DOC collect $518 costs; eligible for Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years; not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
